remarks: If A is not a member of B, but an "if" condition requires it, then the "false" branch results.  This is a simple utility to provide a slight shortening and simplification of proofs vs. applying ~ iffalse directly in this case.  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-May-2015.)
statement: ifnmfalse $p |- ( A e/ B -> if ( A e. B , C , D ) = D ) $.
